chapter.title: Overview
chapter.para: This plugin comes packaged with LuaJ. LuaJ is a Lua interpreter based on the 5.2.x version of Lua. See http://www.luaj.org/luaj/3.0/README.html.
The jar provided by this plugin is luaj-jse-3.0.1.jar. Different jar can be used by configuring the plugin in the Plugin Options window.

chapter.title: Using with Console
chapter.para: If the Console plugin is installed, this plugin automatically sets the system environment variable LUAJ to the path of luaj. So to run a script called 'script.lua', cd to the file's directory (cd $d) and run:

Alternatively, this plugin installs a LuaJ commando file, so scripts can be run by setting it as the interpreter for LuaJ files (Plugin Options -> Console -> Compile & Run), and then Plugins -> Console -> Run Current Buffer.

LuaJPlugin.jar is necessary for the plugins LuaJ Shell and LuaJ-SE Shell (LuaJ scripting engine shell). With LuaJ-SE Shell plugin installed, the LuaJ script handler is available so one can write jEdit macros in LuaJ and test them in the LuaJ scripting engine shell.
